questions.text: Which of the following medications can be a causative for drug induced Psychosis?
questions.solution: can be related to drug induced Psychosis. Several drugs have been reported to have possible neuropsychiatric manifestations.

questions.text: Giving long answers with several tedious and unnecessary details , ultimately reaching the goal is a feature of:
questions.solution: Prolixity is seen in Hypomania and Flight of ideas typically in Mania

questions.text: Angel poise Lamp Sign is seen in:
questions.solution: Catatonia is a motorist phenomenon. The subject may raise limbs even by slightest pressure and maintains posture resembling Angel poise lamp. Signs of Catatonia are important

questions.text: The psychotic patient reports to the doctor that the news anchors are daily giving unique messages for him through news about future state of world. This may be considered as Ideas of?
questions.solution: In Ideas of Reference, the subject believes that neutral events happening around have unique or special meaning for him. Various themes of Delusions are mcq points. Most common type is Persecution

questions.text: False belief not explained by reality ,shared by number of people is termed:
questions.solution: shared by culture or number of people in the community, unlike Delusion which is believed only by subject but not others in community or similar culture.

questions.text: Inability to describe one's own emotion is termed as :

choices.text: Vivid and clear as real perception
Occurs in absence of real, perceptual stimulus

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a feature of Pseudo hallucination?
questions.solution: Occurs in Inner subjective space unlike Hallucination, which occurs in Outer objective space. All other options are true for both Hallucination and Pseudo hallucination.

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a component of Healthy Thinking?
questions.solution: Schneider has enumerated three features characteristic of Healthy Thinking – Constancy, Continuity and Organisation. (I admit, this mcq is beyond your level, but was once asked in DNB exam. So just learn this)

questions.text: Delusions are disorders of _______________ of Thought.
questions.solution: Thought in Mental status Examination has above four descriptions. Obsessions and Thought Alienation are disorders of Possession of Thought

questions.text: A patient in Catatonia was found mimicking the words of examiner during interview. This is:
questions.solution: Echopraxia is mimicking examiner's action

questions.text: Ebstein Anomaly is a teratogenic effect attributed to the mood stabilizer________?
Concept of 'Learned Helplessness', demonstrated by animal models is by:
questions.solution: Classical conditioning and option D related to Operant conditioning.

questions.text: Not a First Rank symptom of Schneider in Schizophrenia is:
questions.solution: DEPERSONALIZTION is a perceptual phenomenon of feeling estranged or detached from oneself.

questions.text: A patient in catatonia was telling 'I love India...India...India'. This repetition of terminal phrase is called:
questions.solution: Logoclonia is the repetition of terminal syllable. Eg” I will take it..t..tt.tt.”

questions.text: Abrupt loss of muscle tone seen in Narcolepsy is termed as:
questions.solution: Often students confuse it with Catalepsy seen in Catatonia, which is maintainenance of posture for long without movements

questions.text: A person laughs suddenly and soon stated crying without any reason. This can be considered as:
questions.solution: Lability is sudden rapid shift of emotions from one pole to another without any external cue

questions.text: Schizophrenia in subjects with Intellectual Disability is termed as:
questions.solution: Option A and D are ICD-10 subtypes of Schizophrenia and Option C was one among another name for Borderline Personality Disorder

questions.text: Which of the following is considered as a core symptom of Major Depressive Disorder?
questions.solution: ANHEDONIA is the inability to enjoy previous pleasurable experience and is a core symptom of Depression

questions.text: NOT a component of Triad of Wernicke's Encephalopathy is:
questions.solution: DEREALIZATION is feeling of unreality in the environment and is a perceptual phenomenon

questions.text: Adverse effects of Sedation and Weight gain are mainly related to which receptors?
questions.solution: HISTAMINE receptors blocking is related to those effects

questions.text: Which of the following is included in DSM5 chapter of Substance and Related Addictive Disorders in DSM 5?
questions.solution: PATHOLOGICAL GAMBLING has been included in the above chapter in DSM5. All other three are Disruptive, Impulse control disorders in DSM5.

questions.text: Which of the following dopaminergic tract is related to extra pyramidal side effects?
questions.solution: Blockade of Nigrostriatal tract causes extra pyramidal symptoms.

questions.text: Which of these is a First Generation Antipsychotic among the Following?
questions.solution: FLUPHENAZINE is Dopamine Receptor Antagonist or Typical Antipsychotic or First Generation Antipsychotic.

questions.text: Which of the following DSM5 personality fits into Phenomenological descriptions of Ernst Kretchmer as 'Unsociable, reservedness, quietness, cold emotional attitudes'?
questions.solution: SCHIZOID PD of cluster A are emotionally indifferent, detached and lacks social relations, prefers solitude.

questions.text: A man saw a rope lying in the ground at night and started yelling 'snake...snake...' This is
questions.solution: ILLUSION is a sensory deception in which there is a misinterpretation of actual stimuli

questions.text: Match box sign is seen in
questions.solution: subject has delusion of infestation by parasites and they often bring dried skin fragments, dried blood, hair etc in containers, which they believe that these are parasites or insects, so as to convince the doctor. This is Matchbox sign

questions.text: Early onset visual hallucinations, Parkinsonian features are seen in which of the following Dementia?
Childhood Mutism in DSM5 is included in :
questions.solution: It is persistent refusal of child to speak in situations where he is expected to, in the absence of lack of knowledge of language or any intellectual, developmental or speech/ language disorders.

questions.text: Which of the following Antipsychotic is a Serotonin Dopamine Antagonist?
questions.solution: are Atypical Antipsychotic or 2nd generation Antipsychotic or Serotonin Dopamine Antagonism

questions.text: Which of the following dopaminergic tract is related to Positive symptoms of Schizophrenia?
questions.solution: Hyperdopaminergic states in this tract lead to positive symptoms

questions.text: Magical Thinking, Egocentricity and Excessive Emotionality are features of:
questions.solution: A question asked in NIMHANS 2015 where many students marked Option A, carried away by the word Magical Thinking. Option A does not have excessive emotionality and Egocentricity.

questions.text: Nightmares differ from Night terrors in:
questions.solution: Night mare occurs in REM and Night Terror occurs in NREM. NREM events are not recalled next day while REM event are recalled.

questions.text: Fear of cats leading to its phobic avoidance is:
questions.solution: AILUROPHOBIA. Option B – pain , option C- Death and option D - Animals

questions.text: A 69-year-old man with depression believes that he is in danger of imminent arrest for murder despite never having committed a crime. This condition is known as:
questions.solution: Usually seen in depression. The subject holds himself guilty of some action or events which have no logical reason to be guilty upon.

questions.text: Fagerstrome test is related to:

Mr.John was flourishing well in business but following covid pandemic, his business suffered a huge loss and had financial crisis. Soon he developed feeling irritable and restless, sleep disturbance and feeling low. He was ok in company of friends and relatives but turns worrisome and tearful in between, mostly when alone. You may consider a diagnosis of
questions.solution:
An often asked question- The presence of an understandable life event stressor like finance, health, relationship – which leads to behavioural and emotional problems causing dysfunction is the key.

Option B is a term used in ICD-10 when both anxiety and depressive symptoms are present.

For option D, there should be catastrophic event and symptom clusters typical of that.

Why not Depression? There are no persistent and pervasive features of low mood, anhedonia and other criterion. The subject may not progress to depression but usual course is gradual improvement as the stressors are eliminated or manageable.

questions.text: A patient on Haloperidol for two years has come to you with uncontrollable, orofacial and limb movements. His chewing and lip smacking movements are noticeable and patient is distressed. The likely diagnosis
questions.solution: TARDIVE DYSKINESIA is a late, often irreversible extra pyramidal symptom that develops following long term antipsychotic use, mostly 1st generation Antipsychotics.

questions.text: Drug of choice in Lithium or Valproate induced tremors is:
questions.solution: PROPRANOLOL. Option C is given in Hyperammonemic encephalopathy due to Valproate

questions.text: Therapeutic level of Lithium targeted in Acute Mania is
Which of the following dopaminergic tract is related to Negative and cognitive symptoms in Schizophrenia?
questions.solution: Mesocortical Tract

questions.text: Difficulty in establishing a therapeutic relationship with a Paranoid Personality Disorder client is due to:
questions.solution: Suspiciousness and difficulty to trust is a core feature of Paranoid PD which makes it difficult to engage them in therapy.

choices.text: Nocturnal penile Tumescence occurs in REM

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT TRUE about REM sleep?
questions.solution: Somnambulism or sleep waking is a Parasomnia that occurs in NREM sleep

questions.text: 'Speed', 'ice', 'crystal' etc are the names of which of the following addictive substance?
Magnan symptoms are related to:
questions.solution: Formication (Tactile hallucination of insect crawling) – also called Cocaine Bugs

questions.text: Which of the following agent used in Alcohol De addiction is considered as an Aversive agent?
questions.solution: DISULFIRAM inhibit Aldehyde dehydrogenase, causing accumulation of Acetaldehyde in blood, which leads to unpleasant effects

questions.text: NOT true about Delirium among the following?
questions.solution: Acute onset and fluctuating course with impaired awareness and attention id the hall mark feature.

questions.text: NOT a feature of Opioid Withdrawal
questions.solution: Diarrhoea, rhinnorhea, lacrimation, salivation, yawning, mydriasis etc can occur.

questions.text: Which of the following Personality disorder may resemble manic episode due to inflated sense of self esteem, sense of entitlement and egocentricity?
questions.solution: NARCISSITIC PD

questions.text: Partial Dopaminergic Agonism is seen in which of the following Antipsychotic?
questions.solution: Along with features of 2nd generation Antipsychotics, presence of partial Dopaminergic Agonism makes Aripiprazole, Brexpiprazole, Cariprazine unique and hence also called “Third generation Antipsychotics”

questions.text: Which of the following dopaminergic tract is related to Hyperprolactinemia?
questions.solution: Blockade of Tuberoinfundibular tract is related to Hyperprolactinemia
